oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Frances Garrett of Lebanon, Tennessee serving in Saudi Arabia with the Tennessee National Guard, circa 1990 November 15
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A close-up photograph of Frances Garrett of Lebanon, Tennessee, wearing a desert camouflage "boonie" hat, mirrored sunglasses, and a scarf tied about her neck. She is a soldier in the Tennessee National Guard, serving in Saudi Arabia during the buildup of American troops during Operation Desert Shield. The photograph was taken by Nashville Banner photographer Larry McCormack on assignment in Saudi Arabia in November 1990. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph transparency : col ; 35mm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Garrett, Frances
